title: Get Media Buy Delivery Request
description: Request parameters for retrieving comprehensive delivery metrics

account.description: Filter delivery data to a specific account. When omitted, returns data across all accessible accounts.

media_buy_ids.description: Array of publisher media buy IDs to get delivery data for

buyer_refs.description: Array of buyer reference IDs to get delivery data for

status_filter.description: Filter by status. Can be a single status or array of statuses

start_date.description: Start date for reporting period (YYYY-MM-DD). When omitted along with end_date, returns campaign lifetime data. Only accepted when the product's reporting_capabilities.date_range_support is 'date_range'.

end_date.description: End date for reporting period (YYYY-MM-DD). When omitted along with start_date, returns campaign lifetime data. Only accepted when the product's reporting_capabilities.date_range_support is 'date_range'.

reporting_dimensions.description: Request dimensional breakdowns in delivery reporting. Each key enables a specific breakdown dimension within by_package â€” include as an empty object (e.g., "device_type": {}) to activate with defaults. Omit entirely for no breakdowns (backward compatible). Unsupported dimensions are silently omitted from the response.

geo.description: Request geographic breakdown. Check reporting_capabilities.supports_geo_breakdown for available levels and systems.

geo_level.description: Geographic granularity level for the breakdown

system.description: Classification system for metro or postal_area levels (e.g., 'nielsen_dma', 'us_zip'). Required when geo_level is 'metro' or 'postal_area'.

limit.description: Maximum number of geo entries to return. Defaults to 25. When truncated, by_geo_truncated is true in the response.

sort_by.description: Metric to sort breakdown rows by (descending). Falls back to 'spend' if the seller does not report the requested metric.

limit.description: Maximum number of entries to return. When omitted, all entries are returned (the enum is small and bounded).
